meanings.sent1: The idea of kindness was ingrafted in her heart from a young age.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the tree were ingrafted into the fertile soil.
meanings.sent3: He ingrafted his love for music into every aspect of his life.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting was ingrafted in her soul like a permanent mark.
meanings.sent5: The values of honesty and integrity were ingrafted in him like a tattoo on his character.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or blend into something else
meanings.sent1: The new flavors were ingrafted into the traditional recipe, creating a unique dish.
meanings.sent2: Her innovative ideas were ingrafted seamlessly into the existing project.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twist ingrafted into the story left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The melody ingrafted into the song added a touch of magic.
meanings.sent5: The new technology was ingrafted into the old system, improving its efficiency.
